conclusion: Analyze motion in two regions: fourth quadrant (magnetic field) and first quadrant (electric field).
In the fourth quadrant, the particle is subjected to a uniform magnetic field perpendicular to the plane (pointing inward).
Magnetic force acts as centripetal force causing circular motion: qvB = mv^2/r, solving for r gives r = mv/qB.
Particle is injected at a 45° angle to the y-axis from the origin O.
Particle follows a circular trajectory in magnetic field until reaching point Q, with angular displacement θ = π/2 radians.
Time taken to move from O to Q is t1 = (π/2)(mv/qB)/v = πm/2qB.
In the first quadrant, the particle is subjected to a uniform electric field directed along the negative y-axis.
Electric force is qE, causing acceleration a = qE/m.
At point Q, velocity components are vx = v/√2, vy = v/√2.
At point P, velocity is directed along positive x-axis with magnitude V0, so vx = V0, vy = 0.
Using kinematic equation for y-direction: vy = vy0 - at, solve for t gives t2 = mv/(√2 qE).
Total time taken for particle to move from O to P is t_total = t1 + t2.
